abstract_summ: CONCLUSIONS: Most neurocritical patients with serologically positive GAD-Abs had other specific autoimmune antibodies.HISTORY: A Covid-19 patient undergoing mechanical ventilation due to related acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), presented altered mental status in the ICU.19 patients underwent continuous EEG (cEEG) for at least 24 hours, and 3 patients underwent routine EEGs (<1 hour).Interpretation: Encephalopathic COVID-19 positive patients had a range of EEG abnormalities, and a higher proportion of patients in this series had electrographic seizures than previous literature suggests.Findings: 17 patients underwent EEG monitoring for unexplained altered mental status changes and 5 patients underwent monitoring for a seizure-like event.
title_summ: Glutamic acid decarboxylase antibodies in neurocritical patients: a culprit or a bystander?Continuous Electroencephalography (cEEG) Characteristics and Acute Symptomatic Seizures in COVID-19 PatientsReport of EEG Finding on Critically Ill Patients with COVID‐19Electroencephalographic (EEG) features of encephalopathy in the setting of Covid-19: A Case SeriesFocal EEG changes indicating critical illness associated cerebral microbleeds in a Covid-19 patient
title_abstract_phrases: CONCLUSIONS: Most neurocritical patients with serologically positive GAD-Abs had other specific autoimmune antibodies.HISTORY: A Covid-19 patient undergoing mechanical ventilation due to related acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), presented altered mental status in the ICU.19 patients underwent continuous EEG (cEEG) for at least 24 hours, and 3 patients underwent routine EEGs (<1 hour).Interpretation: Encephalopathic COVID-19 positive patients had a range of EEG abnormalities, and a higher proportion of patients in this series had electrographic seizures than previous literature suggests.Report of EEG Finding on Critically Ill Patients with COVID‐19In March 2020, we treated a cohort of 26 critically ill hospitalized SARS‐CoV‐2 infected patients who received EEGs to assess unexplained altered mental status, loss of consciousness, or poor arousal and responsiveness.
